QuestionStem: Select the statement(s) below that accurately describe the relationship between chromosomes, genes, and alleles.

options.AnswerText: A. Chromosomes are smaller than alleles.
B. Alleles are the same form of a single gene.
C. Alleles are different forms of genes found on chromosomes.
D. Genes, alleles, and chromosomes are made of DNA.

CorrectFeedback: Genes are segments of DNA. Alleles are different forms of genes, made up of slightly different patterns of base pairs. DNA is organized into chromosomes, which are condensed structures.
PartiallyCorrectFeedback: Think about how the DNA is arranged in a cell.
